definitions.text: (mathematics) a mathematical relation such that each element of a given set (the domain of the function) is associated with an element of another set (the range of the function)
(genetics) the process of locating genes on a chromosome
make a map of; show or establish the features of details of
explore or survey for the purpose of making a map
examples: We haven't even begun to map the many galaxies that we know exist

definitions.text: locate within a specific region of a chromosome in relation to known DNA or gene sequences
plan, delineate, or arrange in detail
depict as if on a map
examples: sorrow was mapped on the mother's face

definitions.text: to establish a mapping (of mathematical elements or sets)
